The following anecdotes from the national report reveal an ugly truth of what Asian Americans faced who reported their experiences with verbal or physical harassment. 4/

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text:
The majority of hate incidents in the national report were verbal harassment at 70.6%, followed by shunning at 21.8%, and physical assault at 8.7%. 

These statistics came from 47 states with the highest number of cases in California (46%), NY (14%), and WA (4%). 

3/

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: @JRosenworcel .@JRosenworcel – thank you too.  It’s more important than ever that we solve the #homeworkgap.  But the good news is that it’s within our power to do so.

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: @JRosenworcel I’ve led the Emergency Educational Connections Act which would direct the FCC to use #ERate to provide hotspots, modems or routers to kids that need to get online at home.  The good news is that the House passed this as part of the #HeroesAct. @JRosenworcel, what’s next?

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: @JRosenworcel That’s right.  In fact, the places that students normally go to catch an internet signal were closed too.  This became a huge obstacle to learning.  The #homeworkgap became a crisis. @JRosenworcel, what can the FCC do?

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: @JRosenworcel According to one study, 29% of New York City residents don’t have broadband.  Another study found that over 500,000 kids across the state don’t have devices.  These figures are especially troubling with the pandemic.  @JRosenworcel, what does that mean for students?

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: @JRosenworcel Every kid deserves their best chance at pursuing an education. But every night kids in #Queens & across the US can't finish their homework simply because they're w/out internet access. That's even more important now. @JRosenworcel you coined the term, how big is the #homeworkgap?

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: I introduced the third amendment after there were public reports of detained parents not being able to speak with their separated children over the phone because they could not afford the above-market prices charged for such calls. #KeepFamiliesTogether 5/5

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: My third amendment allows detained parents who have been separated from their children to make free phone calls to their kids. The measure also allows these parents to confer with counsel over the phone at no cost as well. #KeepFamiliesTogether 4/5

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: My second amendment requires @DHSgov forms that detained individuals must sign – including those used by @ICEgov & @CBP – to be printed fully in Spanish & English. Must ensure those detained at the border & elsewhere can understand what they’re signing. #KeepFamiliesTogether 3/5

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: My first amendment requires the @DHSgov Inspector General to issue a report on @FEMA’s response to Hurricane Maria in #PuertoRico. Critical to have a detailed accounting of how the administration responded to the storm & learn what improvements can be made in the future. 2/5

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: Thanks @CongBoyle for introducing the Reunite Children With Their Parents Act. Proud to support this critical bill. We need to reunite the 2,300 separated children with their families. If this bill becomes law, it would require @DHSgov to reunite separated families in 60 days.

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: Families separated by this administration must be reunited as soon as possible & I call on @RealDonaldTrump to put forward an official plan to do so. It is unacceptable & inhumane that families continue to remain apart. Their nightmares must end. #KeepFamiliesTogether 2/2

name: Grace Meng
tweet_text: .@RealDonaldTrump failed to include in his executive order any explanation on how & when to reunite the estimated 2,300 children who were removed from their parents & I’m deeply troubled-dismayed that a day after he signed it, there is still no clear plan to reunite families. 1/2
